    • Field Detail

      • hasMoved

        public boolean hasMoved
        The King also includes a hasMoved variable because a King can only castle if it has not moved yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • King

        public King(java.lang.String color,
            Chessboard board,
            int row,
            int column)
        King constructor

        The constructor for King calls the ChessPiece super constructor.

        Parameters:
        color - Description: The color of the King. Can be w or b for white and black.
        board - Description: The chessboard the King is located in.
        row - Description: The row the King starts on in the chessboard.
        column - Description: The column the King starts on in the chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidSquare

        public boolean isValidSquare(int row,
                             int column)
        Checks to see if the given square is valid to move onto.

        This function checks to see whether it is a valid move to move onto the square with the given row and column. It is valid if it is empty or if there is a piece of the opposite color there.

        The move is invalid if the move takes the King outside the board (row or column greater than 8 or less than 0) and if there is another piece of the same color on that square.

        Parameters:
        row - Description: The row of the square being checked for whether it is valid to move onto.
        column - Description: The column of the square being checked for whether it is valid to move onto.
        Returns:
        Description: Returns true if the King can move onto the given square and false otherwise.

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableMoves()
        Gets all available moves for the King.

        Calls the isValidSquare function for the squares that a King can move to: A King can move one square in any direction.

        If the isValidSquare function returns true for a given position, then that position's letter-number combination will be added to an ArrayList of all possible moves for the King.

        Specified by:
        getAvailableMoves in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the ArrayList of all possible moves the King can take.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(java.lang.String destination)
        Checks to see if the given move is valid to for the King piece considering the rules of check.

        This statement checks to see if the move will put the King in check. If it will, it returns false. Otherwise, it returns true.

        The move is invalid if the move keeps the King in check after it is completed.

        Overrides:
        isValidMove in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        destination - Description: designated move location to check for validity
        Returns:
        Description: Returns true if the King can move onto the given square without being in check once complete.

      • castling

        public boolean castling(int horizontalMovement)
        Checks to see if the selected King piece would castle with the given move, and if it is a valid move to do.

        This statement checks to see if the move will put the King in castling. If it will, it returns true if that is possible (not blocked, rook hasn't moved, King hasn't moved), Otherwise, it returns false if castling in that direction is not valid.

        Castling is invalid if either the King or the selected rook has moved, or if there are still pieces between the King and rook.

        Parameters:
        horizontalMovement - Description: the amount (and direction: positive/negative) that the piece is being requested to move horizontally, effectively which rook to castle with.
        Returns:
        Description: Returns true if the King can castle in that direction.

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String command)
        Overwrites default move function from ChessPiece

        This function returns nothing and moves the King piece to the designated location by calling the super class move function and then updating to confirm the piece is not in its starting position as well as telling the board where the Kings currently are for check purposes.

        Overrides:
        move in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        command - Description: the designated location to travel to for this King piece.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of this piece.

        Returns a String representation of this piece, which is its one-letter color appended by "K", representing its status as a King.

        Specified by:
        toString in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the string representation of this piece.
